result.execSummary:
The defendant Allen L Downing was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run - Attended Vehicle, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Allen L Downing

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Allen L Downing in court with attorney Joshua P Grube.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee files an amended information with the court and the defense.  Atty Hendee states that the charge is amended to a Misd. Hit and Run.
Atty Hendee states that there will be an argued sentence.  Atty Hendee states that the victim would like to make a statement to the court.
Atty Grube agrees and has received the amended information.  Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Atty Grube enters a No Contest plea.  Court questions defendant regarding plea. 
Atty Hendee relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis. Atty Grube agrees.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of the amended charge.

Victim makes a statement to the court.
Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Grube makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Amended charge:  Pay fine of $900 + costs = $1,387.00 (does not include surcharge in this)
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
Defendant to arrange a payment plan with the COC office.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 15, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Final pre-trial on August 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on September 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Allen L Downing in court with attorney Joshua P Grube.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that there has been ongoing conversations regarding settlement; however at this time the parties are not in agreement.  Atty agrees and asks that this be put on the trial calendar.

BY THE COURT:  Set for trial
bond continued.  Jury trial scheduled for September 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Allen L Downing in court with attorney Joshua P Grube.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Grube; the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today.  Atty Grube agrees and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee states that since the defendant was not here at the last hearing; he would like confirmation of the criminal complaint.
 Atty Grube states that the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.
Atty Hendee files the information with the Court.  Atty Grube states that the Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading.  Atty Grube enters a Not Guilty plea.

BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea entered.
Set for Return.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

*Appear for booking by 4:30pm Friday, January 15th.
*No contact with Robert Bormann

Attorney Joshua P Grube in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Grube states that his client called him 1/2 hour ago and his truck broke down.  Atty Grube states that his client has been in contact with him and states that he can get his client here to sign the bond and appear for booking within the next week.

  Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.  Atty Hendee asks that the bond be signed by the end of business on Friday.
  
BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*Appear for booking by 4:30pm Friday, January 15th.
*No contact with Robert Bormann

Reset Initial Appearance  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
